conclusion: A particle is moving in a straight line along the x-axis, and its v-t graph is shown in the figure. The particle is located at x = 5 m at t = 0 and starts moving in the positive direction of the x-axis. When t = 8 s, the task is to find the position of the particle on the x-axis.
From t = 0 to t = 1s: Velocity increases linearly from 0 to 2 m/s
From t = 1 to t = 3s: Constant velocity of 2 m/s
From t = 3 to t = 4s: Velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0
From t = 4 to t = 5s: Velocity is 0 m/s
From t = 5 to t = 6s: Velocity decreases linearly from 0 to -1 m/s
From t = 6 to t = 7s: Constant velocity of -1 m/s
From t = 7 to t = 8s: Velocity increases linearly from -1 m/s to 0

premise: Velocity increases linearly from 0 to 2 m/s from t = 0 to t = 1s
conclusion: Displacement from t = 0 to t = 1s is 1 m

premise: Constant velocity of 2 m/s from t = 1 to t = 3s
conclusion: Displacement from t = 1 to t = 3s is 4 m

premise: Velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 from t = 3 to t = 4s
conclusion: Displacement from t = 3 to t = 4s is 1 m

premise: Velocity is 0 m/s from t = 4 to t = 5s
conclusion: Displacement from t = 4 to t = 5s is 0 m

premise: Velocity decreases linearly from 0 to -1 m/s from t = 5 to t = 6s
conclusion: Displacement from t = 5 to t = 6s is -0.5 m

premise: Constant velocity of -1 m/s from t = 6 to t = 7s
conclusion: Displacement from t = 6 to t = 7s is -1 m

premise: Velocity increases linearly from -1 m/s to 0 from t = 7 to t = 8s
conclusion: Displacement from t = 7 to t = 8s is -0.5 m
